item.title: Midi player... WITH GUI!
item.dc:creator: @marluxia marluxia
item.description:
@marluxia wrote:

[code]import javax.swing.;
import javax.swing.event.;
import java.awt.;
import java.io.;
import java.awt.event.;
import java.util.Date;
import javax.sound.midi.;
import java.util.*;

public class Bot
implements ActionListener, ListSelectionListener {

	private String frameTitle = "A music type thing";


	public static void main(String[] args) {
        new Bot(args);
	}

private Bot(String[] args) {
        GUI();
	midiPlayer("Play");
	String s = "";
	}

	public static synchronized void print(String message) {
	message = new java.text.SimpleDateFormat("[hh:mm:ss]").format(new Date()) + " " + message;
	System.out.println(message);
}

  public static void Box(String title, String message) {
	JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, message, title, JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE);
}


	private void GUI() {
      try {
    	      JFrame.setDefaultLookAndFeelDecorated(true);

    	      JFrame frame = new JFrame(frameTitle);
		
		//java.net.URL icon = Bot.class.getResource("Icon.jpg");
		//frame.setIconImage(new ImageIcon(icon).getImage());
    
    	      frame.setResizable(false);
    	      frame.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);

		file = new File("./MIDI");
		String files[] = file.list();
		Vector entries = new Vector();
		for (int i = 0; i < files.length; i++)
		if(files[i].endsWith("mid")) entries.addElement(files[i]);
		
		list = new JList(entries);
			list.setVisibleRowCount(0);
		list.addListSelectionListener(this);
		JScrollPane listPane = new JScrollPane(list);
       	
		JPanel Panel = new JPanel();
        	Panel.setLayout(new BorderLayout());
        	Panel.setPreferredSize(new Dimension(200, 381));
		Panel.add(listPane);

	
              JMenuBar menuBar = new JMenuBar();
              JMenu musicMenu = new JMenu("Music");
	      JMenu helpMenu = new JMenu("Help");

		String[] mainButtons = new String[]{
				"Next Midi", "Previous Midi", "-", "Play", "Stop"
		};
		String[] helpButtons = new String[]{
				"About"
		};

		for (String name : mainButtons) {
			JMenuItem menuItem = new JMenuItem(name);
			if (name.equalsIgnoreCase("-"))
				musicMenu.addSeparator();
			else {
				menuItem.addActionListener(this);
				musicMenu.add(menuItem);
			}
		}
		for (String name : helpButtons) {
			JMenuItem menuItem = new JMenuItem(name);
			if (name.equalsIgnoreCase("-"))
				helpMenu.addSeparator();
			else {
                          menuItem.addActionListener(this);
                          helpMenu.add(menuItem);
			}
		}

		menuBar.add(musicMenu);
		menuBar.add(helpMenu);
		frame.getContentPane().add(Panel, BorderLayout.CENTER);
		frame.getContentPane().add(menuBar, BorderLayout.NORTH);
    	     	frame.pack();
    	     	frame.setVisible(true);

         } catch (Exception e) {
	     print("A general exception occured in initUI()");
	     e.printStackTrace();
	 }
   }

public int getFileNumber(File file) 
{
	File dir = new File("./MIDI");
	File files[] = dir.listFiles();
	for (int i = 0; i < files.length; i++) 
	if(files[i].equals(file))  
	return i;

return 0;
}

private void midiPlayer(String s)
{
    if(sequencer != null && sequencer.isRunning())
    {
        sequencer.stop();
        sequencer.close();
    }
    if(s.equals("Next")) {
        midiCount++;
	midiPlayer("Play");
    } else
  if(s.equals("Previous")) {
        midiCount--;
	midiPlayer("Play");
    } else
    if(!s.equals("Stop")) 
        try
        {
            String as[] = file.list();
            if(as.length > 0)
            {
                if(midiCount > as.length - 1)
                    midiCount = as.length - 1;
                if(midiCount < 0)
                    midiCount = 0;
                System.out.println("Playing " + as[midiCount]);
                file1 = new File("MIDI/" + as[midiCount]);
                try
                {
                    sequencer = MidiSystem.getSequencer();
                    sequencer.setSequence(MidiSystem.getSequence(file1));
                    sequencer.setLoopCount(-1);
                    sequencer.open();
                    sequencer.start();
                }
                catch(MidiUnavailableException midiunavailableexception)
                {
                    System.out.println("Midi device unavailable!");
                }
                catch(InvalidMidiDataException invalidmididataexception)
                {
                    System.out.println("Invalid Midi data!");
                }
                catch(IOException ioexception)
                {
                    System.out.println("I/O Error!");
                }
            }
        }
        catch(Exception exception)
        {
            System.out.println("MIDI file gone!");
        }
    else
        System.out.println("Stopped");
}

public void valueChanged(ListSelectionEvent evt) {
	value = list.getSelectedValue();
	file1 = new File("./MIDI/" + value);
	midiCount = getFileNumber(file1);
	midiPlayer("Play");
}

public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent evt) {
	String cmd = evt.getActionCommand();

	if (cmd != null) {
		if (cmd.equalsIgnoreCase("Quit")) {
                    print("Quiting...");
			System.exit(-1);

		}
		if (cmd.equalsIgnoreCase("About")) {
			Box("About", "It plays Music!");
					 
		}
		if(cmd.equalsIgnoreCase("Next Midi"))
              midiPlayer("Next");
              if(cmd.equalsIgnoreCase("Previous Midi"))
              midiPlayer("Previous");
              if(cmd.equalsIgnoreCase("Play"))
              midiPlayer("Play");
              if(cmd.equalsIgnoreCase("Stop"))
              midiPlayer("Stop");
        }
  }

public String as[];
public File file;
public Object value;
public JList list;
public File files[];
public File file1;
public int midiCount;
public Sequencer sequencer;

}[/code]

Yea thank’s 1337hax and Bobdole for the “getFileNumber” thing oh and mopar for the midi player um yea sorry if I forgot anyone EDIT and WhitwCastle and Drunk on Java (because they said so)

Questions and Answers you may or may not have:
Q) No working mr marlucia?
A) add a “/MIDI/” folder (with your midis) in the same folder as the program.

Q) No playing my mp3s mr Marluxia?
A) It’s a midi player not a mp3 player

Read full topic
